Chagas' Disease (Chronic) With Other Organ Involvement

Chagas disease (CD) is a disease caused by Trypanosoma cruzi, ranking among the world’s most neglected diseases. There is significant associated morbidity and mortality,  particularly in chronic phase with target organ involvement. In Latin America, 21 countries are endemic for CD with an estimated 70 million people at risk. Spain has an estimated 46,000 people infected. The current treatment for CD has significant limitations and new therapeutic options are urgently needed.;Therapeutic area: Diseases [C] - Parasitic Diseases [C03]
